description: Latin ampliātus, past participle of ampliō (“to make wider”).

adjectives.description: ampliate (comparative more ampliate, superlative most ampliate)

entries.meaning: (zoology) Having the outer edge prominent; said of the wings of insects.

verbs.description: ampliate (third-person singular simple present ampliates, present participle ampliating, simple past and past participle ampliated)

examples: In this and the two following genera the space between the postcostal vein and ulnar ramus is distinctly ampliated towards the ape
